page.title: 08NATIONAL TRUST SANDYMOUTH
page.content: The land around Sandymouth was bought by the{National Trust}from Mr Green who owned the land for over 20 years.The area is quite open and unspoilt with a valley and stream decending to{2 waterfalls}at the beach. Along the steep valley is a track leading to the beach and to one side a single-storey stone building which serves as a cafe. Mr Green who lives in{Poughill}runs the cafe with his wife and 3 other helpers.The cafe sells hot and cold drinks,pasties,and cakes.Near the cafe a large{car-park}has recently been excavated out of the hillside.Mr Green is a very hospitable man and welcomes everyone to the cafe. He even provides dogs with fresh water in a granite trough outside and often feeds them with scraps from the kitchen.
